item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS 15.2 breaks the ability to copy the OS to another drive (242 points | 131 comments)
2. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (213 points | 32 comments)
3. Luon programming language (112 points | 41 comments)
4. Ilya Sutskever Test of Time Talk "Pre-training as we know it will end" (52 points | 6 comments)
5. Energy-Harvesting Electronic Holiday Card 2024 (42 points | 5 comments)
6. Show HN: Performant intracontinental public transport routing in Rust (52 points | 4 comments)
7. Graphene Interconnects Aim to Give Moore's Law New Life (11 points | 2 comments)
8. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (179 points | 47 comments)
9. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (2010) (120 points | 38 comments)
10. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (141 points | 28 comments)
11. Htmx 2.0.4 Released (123 points | 57 comments)
12. Making my first robot as a software engineer (245 points | 29 comments)
13. McKinsey and Company to pay $650M for role in opioid crisis (227 points | 117 comments)
14. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (112 points | 39 comments)
15. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (161 points | 18 comments)
16. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (163 points | 25 comments)
17. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (178 points | 117 comments)
18. Idiomatic Errors in Clojure (29 points | 5 comments)
19. OpenAI whistleblower found dead in San Francisco apartment (525 points | 186 comments)
20. Donald Bitzer has died (172 points | 19 comments)
21. Is it possible to build a perfectly spherical prince Ruperts drop (2015) (32 points | 10 comments)
22. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (73 points | 24 comments)
23. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (101 points | 33 comments)
24. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they’re made (181 points | 51 comments)
25. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (386 points | 189 comments)
26. Mysterious tablet with unknown language unearthed in Georgia (73 points | 47 comments)
27. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (253 points | 61 comments)
28. Elon Musk wanted an OpenAI for-profit (466 points | 478 comments)
29. Pompeii experts back Pliny's account of Mount Vesuvius eruption date (47 points | 18 comments)
30. NASA believes it understands why Ingenuity crashed on Mars (74 points | 40 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
